dict.string:
url="$(pbpaste)"
if [[ "{query}" == "short" ]]; then # expand short url expanded=$(curl -sIL "${url}" | grep '^Location' | head -1 | sed 's/Location: //') # change url to it, if it was expanded [[ -n "${expanded}" ]] && url="${expanded}" fi
# remove 'm.' 'mobile.' 'touch.', 'utm' 'ref', 'ref=' from amazon, anything after '&' or '?' from facebook perl -pe 's/(https?:\/\/)(m\.|mobile\.|touch\.)(.*)/\1\3/;s/([?&]utm.*|[?&]ref.*)//;s/(https:\/\/www\.amazon\..*\/)ref=.*/\1/;s/(https:\/\/www\.facebook\.com\/.*\/)[?&].*/\1/' <<< "${url}" | tr -d '\n'

cat << EOF <?xml version='1.0'?><items> <item uid='long' valid='yes' arg='long'> <title>Long link clean</title> <subtitle>For long URLs where you see the extraneous information</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> <item uid='short' valid='yes' arg='short'> <title>Shortened link clean</title> <subtitle>For shortened URLs where you do not see the extraneous information (use if uncertain)</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> </items> EOF

Clean clutter from URLs such as all sorts of [`utm_` variants](http://www.bytefive.com/blogs/understanding-utm_source-utm_medium-and-utm_campaign) and subdomains like `m.` for mobile sites.
Copy a link to your clipboard and call `lc` in Alfred. The clean link will both be copied to your clipboard and pasted to your frontmost app.
![](http://i.imgur.com/Gxld0YS.png)
The option for shortened links will also work on long URLs. This option, however, takes a bit longer since it needs to first make a call to expand it into its longer form, which is why there are two options — if you have a long link and pick that option, it’ll be way faster (and does not require internet connectivity).
